description.p: Sends an email using either the internal SMTP server or SparkPost using the settings defined in Web Project Properties.

prototypes.prototype: dim result as P = email_send_web(C from ,C from_alias ,C to ,C cc ,C bcc ,C subject ,C message [,C attachments])

description.p: The friendly/display name of the sender.
A comma delimited list of email addresses.
A comma delimited list of email addresses to "CC".
A comma delimited list of email addresses to "BCC".
The message to send. Can contain HTML.
A comma delimited list of files to attach to the email.
Returns an object with the following properties:

property.name: error
property.description: A *[xb:.t.]* or *[xb:.f.]* value. If *[xb:.t.]*, an error occurred. Additional error information will be available in the *[xb:errorText]* property. If *[xb:.f.]*, the email was successfully sent.

property.name: errorText
property.description: A message containing additional information about why the email failed to send. This property only exists if *[xb:error]* is *[xb:.t.]*.

discussion.p: The *[xb:email_send_web()]* function sends an email using settings defined in the Web Project Properties. The email will be sent using either the internal SMTP server or the SparkPost REST service.

p.example:
dim from as C = "jane@biz.org" dim from_alias as C = "Jane Smith" dim to as C = "charles@gomail.co" dim cc as C = "" dim bcc as C = "" dim subject as C = "Thank you for registering!" dim message as C = "We look forward to seeing you at next week's event." dim attachments as C = ""
result = email_send_web(from, from_alias, to, cc, bcc, subject, message, attachments)
if (result.error == .f.) then ' Success! else ' Something went wrong... dim errorMessage as C = result.errorText
showvar(errorMessage)
end if

note.p: This function does not work with Mandrill. Use [email_send_mandrill()] if you wish to send emails using Mandrill.
